Description

Basic IR for code generation.

Synopsis
  • data IRFunDecl tname name = IRFunDecl {
    • irfName :: IRFunName name
    • irfType :: IRFunType tname
    • irfDef :: IRFunDef tname name
    }
  • data IRFunDef tname name
    • = IRFunPrim
    • | IRFunDef [name] (IRExpr tname name)
  • data IRFunName name = IRFunName {
    • irfnName :: IRFunNameFlavor name
    • irfnInstance :: FunInstance
    }
  • data IRFunNameFlavor name
    • = IRPrimName IRPrim
    • | IRDeclaredFunName name
  • data IRPrim
    • = CryPrim PrimIdent
    • | ArrayLit
    • | ArrayLookup
    • | WordLookup
    • | Tuple
    • | TupleSel Int Int
    • | EqSize
    • | LtSize
    • | LeqSize
    • | FlatMap
    • | Zip
    • | ArrayToWord
    • | ArrayToStream
    • | WordToStream
    • | StreamToWord
    • | StreamToArray
    • | Head
    • | Hist
  • newtype FunInstance = FunInstance [ParamInfo]
  • data ParamInfo
    • = NumFixed Nat'
    • | NumVar SizeVarSize
    • | TyBool
    • | TyNotBool
    • | TyAny
  • newtype IRExpr tname name = IRExpr (IRExprF tname name (IRExpr tname name))
  • data IRExprF tname name expr
    • = IRVar (IRName tname name)
    • | IRCallFun (IRCall tname name expr)
    • | IRClosure (IRCall tname name expr)
    • | IRLam [IRName tname name] expr
    • | IRIf expr expr expr
    • | IRLet (IRName tname name) expr expr
    • | IRStream (IRStreamExpr tname name expr)
  • data IRName tname name = IRName {
    • irNameName :: name
    • irNameType :: IRType tname
    }
  • data IRCall tname name expr = IRCall {
    • ircFun :: IRCallable tname name expr
    • ircFunType :: !(IRFunType tname)
    • ircArgTypes :: [IRType tname]
    • ircResType :: IRType tname
    • ircArgs :: [expr]
    }
  • data IRCallable tname name expr
    • = IRTopFun (IRTopFunCall tname name)
    • | IRFunVal expr
  • data IRTopFunCall tname name = IRTopFunCall {
    • irtfName :: IRFunName name
    • irtfTypeArgs :: [IRType tname]
    • irtfSizeArgs :: [(IRSize tname, SizeVarSize)]
    }
  • topCallTypeArgs :: IRTopFunCall tname name -> [IRType tname]
  • callPrimG :: IRPrim -> [(IRSize tname, SizeVarSize)] -> [IRExpr tname name] -> IRType tname -> IRExpr tname name
  • callSizePrim :: IRPrim -> [(IRSize tname, SizeVarSize)] -> IRType tname -> IRExpr tname name
  • callPrim :: IRPrim -> [IRExpr tname name] -> IRType tname -> IRExpr tname name
  • mkTuple :: [IRExpr tname name] -> IRExpr tname name
  • data IRStreamExpr tname name expr = IRStreamExpr {
    • irsType :: IRType tname
    • irsExterns :: [(IRName tname name, expr)]
    • irsRec :: IRStreamRec expr
    • irsNext :: expr
    }
  • data IRStreamRec expr
    • = NonRecStream
    • | RecStream expr
  • data IRType tname
    • = TBool
    • | TInteger
    • | TIntegerMod (IRSize tname)
    • | TRational
    • | TFloat
    • | TDouble
    • | TWord (IRSize tname)
    • | TArray (IRSize tname) (IRType tname)
    • | TStream (IRStreamSize tname) (IRType tname)
    • | TTuple [IRType tname]
    • | TFun [IRType tname] (IRType tname)
    • | TPoly tname
  • class HasType t where
    • typeOf :: t -> IRType (TName t)
  • data IRStreamSize tname
    • = IRInfSize
    • | IRSize (IRSize tname)
  • data IRSize tname
    • = IRFixedSize Integer
    • | IRPolySize (IRSizeName tname)
    • | IRComputedSize TFun [IRSize tname]
  • data IRSizeName tname = IRSizeName {
    • irsName :: tname
    • irsSize :: SizeVarSize
    }
  • data SizeVarSize
    • = MemSize
    • | LargeSize
  • isKnownStreamSize :: IRStreamSize tname -> Maybe Nat'
  • isKnownSize :: IRSize tname -> Maybe Integer
  • pattern K :: Integer -> IRStreamSize tname
  • maxSizeVal :: Integer
  • data IRFunType tname = IRFunType {
    • ftTypeParams :: [tname]
    • ftTraits :: [IRTrait tname]
    • ftSizeParams :: [IRSizeName tname]
    • ftParams :: [IRType tname]
    • ftResult :: IRType tname
    }
  • data IRTrait tname = IRTrait {
    • irTraitName :: IRTraitName
    • irTraitType :: tname
    }
  • data IRTraitName
  • traitMap :: Ord tname => [IRTrait tname] -> Map tname [IRTraitName]
  • type family VName a
  • type family TName t

data IRFunDef tname name #

The definition of a top-level function.

Constructors

IRFunPrim

A primitive function.

IRFunDef [name] (IRExpr tname name)

Function with definition. Includes names of the function parameters. Their types are in the function's type.

data IRPrim #

This is for primitivies specifi to the IR (i.e., *not* the primitives of Cryptol)

Constructors

CryPrim PrimIdent

A Cryptol primitve

ArrayLit 
ArrayLookup

(index : usize, xs: Array n T) -> T The index to look at is in the *size* args of the call The parameter is the name of the array Unspecified behavior if index >= n

WordLookup

(index: usize, xs: Word n) -> Bool

Tuple

Make a tuple.

TupleSel Int Int

select_n_of_N(tuple) Index n-th element in a tuple of size N

EqSize

Check if two sizes are the same. They are in the size args of the call

LtSize

Compare two size types. They are in the size args of the call

LeqSize

Compare two size types. They are in the size args of the call

FlatMap

(xs : Stream m a, f : a -> Stream n b) -> Stream (m*n) b

Zip

(xs : Stream m a, ys : Stream n b) -> Stream (min m n) (a,b)

ArrayToWord
Array n Bool  -> Word n
ArrayToStream
Array n a     -> Stream n a
WordToStream
Array n a     -> Stream n Bool
StreamToWord
Stream n Bool -> Word n
StreamToArray
Stream n a    -> Array n a
Head

Next element of external stream. (xs: Stream n a) -> a

Hist

Past element of a recursive stream. 0 is most recent. (index: usize) -> a

data ParamInfo #

A pattern in a function instance. NOTE: Ordering of constructors is important. More specific ones should come *before* less specific ones

data IRExprF tname name expr #

The various flavours of expressions. Expressions are split in two parts because this makes it easier to write generic traversals.

Constructors

IRVar (IRName tname name) 
IRCallFun (IRCall tname name expr)

Call a function

IRClosure (IRCall tname name expr)

Partial application

IRLam [IRName tname name] expr

Lambda

IRIf expr expr expr 
IRLet (IRName tname name) expr expr 
IRStream (IRStreamExpr tname name expr)

Function Calls

data IRCall tname name expr #

Information about a function call or a closure. Note: we keep the types of arguments around, as they are convenient to have for backends that use more refined representations of types, and so the argument types need to be adjusted.

Constructors

IRCall 

Fields

  • ircFun :: IRCallable tname name expr

    What we are calling

  • ircFunType :: !(IRFunType tname)

    Type of the function we are calling (uninstantiated)

  • ircArgTypes :: [IRType tname]

    Types of arguments (types of ircArgs)

  • ircResType :: IRType tname

    Result of function, or closure type

  • ircArgs :: [expr]

    Available arguments

Instances

data IRSize tname #

Size "types". These are typically not erased, to they are really values. These are supposed to be finite.

Constructors

IRFixedSize Integer

A specific size

IRPolySize (IRSizeName tname)

Polymorphic size; finite

IRComputedSize TFun [IRSize tname]

Computed size
